\sphinxAtStartPar
Forecast future values using ARIMA models.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Args:}
\sphinxAtStartPar

df (pd.DataFrame): Data frame containing the data.

replace\_negative\_forecast (bool): Whether to replace negative forecast values with zero.

\sphinxAtStartPar
dict: Forecast results for each country.

\end{description}

\section{Plotting module}
\label{\detokenize{Plotting:module-Plotting}}\label{\detokenize{Plotting:plotting-module}}\label{\detokenize{Plotting::doc}}\index{module@\spxentry{module}!Plotting@\spxentry{Plotting}}\index{Plotting@\spxentry{Plotting}!module@\spxentry{module}}\index{plot\_data() (in module Plotting)@\spxentry{plot\_data()}\spxextra{in module Plotting}}

\begin{fulllineitems}
\phantomsection\label{\detokenize{Plotting:Plotting.plot_data}}
\pysigstartsignatures
\pysiglinewithargsret{\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Plotting.}}\sphinxbfcode{\sphinxupquote{plot\_data}}}{\sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{df}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{forecast\_results}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{forecast\_key}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{variable}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{plot\_type}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{ax}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{add\_forecast\_start\_line}}\sphinxparamcomma \sphinxparam{\DUrole{n}{show\_confidence\_interval}}}{}
\pysigstopsignatures
\sphinxAtStartPar
Plot data and forecasts on a matplotlib axis.
\begin{description}
\sphinxlineitem{Args:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
df (pd.DataFrame): Data frame containing the data.
forecast\_results (dict): Forecast results.
forecast\_key (str): Key for the forecast result.
variable (str): Variable to plot.
plot\_type (str): Type of plot (“Historical”, “Forecast”, “Both”).
ax (matplotlib.axes.Axes): Matplotlib axis to plot on.
add\_forecast\_start\_line (bool): Whether to add a line indicating the start of the forecast.
show\_confidence\_interval (bool): Whether to show confidence intervals.

\sphinxlineitem{Returns:}
\sphinxAtStartPar
float: Maximum value in the plotted data.

\end{description}

\end{fulllineitems}
